alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued October 03 at 4:38AM EDT until October 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Norfolk/Portsmouth and Hampton/Poquoson Counties, and Chesapeake. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Severe flooding will cause extensive inundation and flooding of numerous roads and buildings resulting in a significant threat to property and life. Water will be 2 to 3 feet or more above ground level in some areas. Severe flooding will extend inland from the waterfront and shoreline flooding homes, businesses and isolating some neighborhoods. Numerous roads will be impassable under several feet of water and cars submerged. Some areas may need to be evacuated. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/03 AM 4.9 2.1 2.6 4-5 MINOR 03/04 PM 6.7 3.9 3.8 5 MAJOR 04/04 AM 5.8 3.0 3.5 3 MODERATE 04/05 PM 5.6 2.8 2.6 2-3 MODERATE 05/06 AM 4.8 2.0 2.3 2 MINOR 05/06 PM 5.0 2.2 2.0 1-2 MINOR CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
